Hello,

My problem involves a two phase flow in a evaporator.
So I have liquid and vapor at a constant pressure and
temperature.

I need calculate this derivative

D(ro)/D(p) 

where ro is density and p is the pressure.

How I can obtain D(ro)/D(p) ? Using thermodynamic
tables? Using pv = RT? (but see I have vapor and liquid
not a gas) Using a numerical method?
Can I use the sound velocity for obtain this derivative?
See : B = (ro)*(D(ro)/D(p))
where B is the bulk modulus (constant temperature process)


What's the better choice?

Thanks for help

Kromatikian
